info.game_comments: First regular-play game to end in a Tiebreaker Round.

jeopardy_round: THAT'S ABOUT THE SIZE OF IT

(1, 1).clue: This smallest U.S. state can fit inside the Big Island of Hawaii

(2, 1).clue: "America runs on" baked goods & coffee from this alliterative chain that began franchising in 1955

(3, 1).clue: Crassus, Pompey & this guy made up the first Roman triumvirate

(4, 1).clue: If a friend is building a wall or a whole house, mail him this basic piece of material, standard size 3 5/8 & 2 1/4 x 8 inches

(5, 1).clue: Erin Murphy was Tabitha, the nose-twitching daughter witch on this 1960s sitcom

(1, 2).clue: Think there are a lot of people in the eastern United States? Compare this country and there's clearly room for a billion

(2, 2).clue: In 1989 Auntie Anne's began selling lemonade & these from its first store location

(4, 2).clue: Your buddy needs to play ultimate, so Wham-O! Send an All Sport or Dyn-O-Glo one of these

(5, 2).clue: Erin Moran was Joanie, the non-nose-twitching daughter on this 1970s sitcom

(6, 2).clue: This butterfly is named for a much larger animal

(1, 3).clue: With no Mercator projection, this island from up north doesn't look so big--it's smaller than Argentina

(2, 3).clue: Oh yeah, I'll have a blast at this franchised drive-in that once promised "service at the speed of sound"

(3, 3).clue: As its name suggests, this caravel was the smallest of Columbus' ships in 1492

(4, 3).clue: Take a whack at sending this candy-filled party item; rainbow donkey is a popular type

(5, 4).clue: This CNN anchor tries to stay ahead of the news on her show "Out Front"

(1, 5).clue: This Scandinavian country is larger than California, but California has 30 million more people

(2, 5).clue: If you can't get to Louisiana, visit this chain named for a  "French Connection" character, not a cartoon one

(3, 5).clue: With Israel's Yitzhak Rabin & Shimon Peres, this man won the 1994 Nobel Peace Prize

(4, 5).clue: Slap an address & postage on this tropical item & the recipient can enjoy its solid dried meat called copra

(2, 1).clue: Today a secretary is often rightly called this 14-letter type of "assistant"

(3, 1).clue: "We never broke up, we just took a 14-year vacation", said Glenn Frey at this band's first reunion show in 1994

(4, 1).clue: Suzuki Roshi, a master of this type of Buddhism, coined the term "beginner's mind" for seeing the world afresh

(5, 1).clue: Behaving like this hard-charging hero of a 1605 Spanish work has become shorthand for impractical idealism

(1, 2).clue: This slimy membrane lines the organs & passages of the alimentary canal

(2, 2).clue: To kill the pathogenic microorganisms in milk using this process, it's necessary to heat it to at least 145°F

(3, 2).clue: The Jackson 5 reunited in 1983 for this record label's 25th anniversary special

(4, 2).clue: Customized online content can keep people in a "filter" this, the title of a 2012 book that suggest peeking out of yours

(5, 2).clue: In "Little Women" this character declares, "I'm dying to go and fight with Papa. And I can only stay at home & knit"

(6, 2).clue: Anemometers measure this, especially in a tunnel

(2, 3).clue: Can I tell you something this way, just between ourselves?

(3, 3).clue: The setlist at their 2007 reunion show included "Kashmir" & "In My Time Of Dying"

(4, 3).clue: St. Paul wrote, "For now we see through" this, "darkly; but then face to face"

(5, 3).clue: This one of Dumas' 3 musketeers is the extrovert of the group--loud, brash & a courageous fighter & friend

(6, 3).clue: Consult a galvanometer to measure amperes of this

(2, 4).clue: Like layers of rock, it's the hierarchical division of society according to rank, caste or class

(3, 4).clue: An estimated 500,000 people jammed New York's Central Park to see this duo's 1981 reunion concert

(0, 0).clue: Once known as the Norman Isles, per the British government this group is "not part of the U.K." & has "never been colonies"
